addTip(uint256,uint256).details: Allows the user to tip miners for the specified request using Tributes

addTipWithEther(uint256).details: Allows user to add tip with Ether by sending the ETH to the userContract and exchanging it for Tributes at the price specified by the userContract owner.

constructor.details: This function sents the owner and userContract address

getAnyDataAfter(uint256,uint256).details: Allows the user to get the first value for the requestId after the specified timestamp

params._requestId: is the requestId to look up the value for
params._timestamp: after which to search for first verified value

getAnyDataAfter(uint256,uint256).return: bool true if it is able to retreive a value, the value, and the value's timestamp

getCurrentValue(uint256).details: Allows the user to get the latest value for the requestId specified

params._requestId: is the requestId to look up the value for

getCurrentValue(uint256).return: bool true if it is able to retreive a value, the value, and the value's timestamp

getFirstVerifiedDataAfter(uint256,uint25.details: Allows the user to get the first verified value for the requestId after the specified timestamp

params._requestId: is the requestId to look up the value for
params._timestamp: after which to search for first verified value

getFirstVerifiedDataAfter(uint256,uint25.return: bool true if it is able to retreive a value, the value, and the value's timestamp, the timestamp after which it searched for the first verified value

requestData(string,string,uint256,uint25.details: Allows the user to submit a request for data to the oracle using Tributes Allowing this prevents us from increasing spread too high (since if we set the price too hight users will just go to an exchange and get tokens from there)

params._granularity: is the number of decimals miners should include on the submitted value
params._request: string API being requested to be mined
params._symbol: is the short string symbol for the api request
params._tip: amount the requester is willing to pay to be get on queue. Miners mine the onDeckQueryHash, or the api with the highest payout pool

requestDataWithEther(string,string,uint2.details: Allows the user to submit a request for data to the oracle using ETH

params._granularity: is the number of decimals miners should include on the submitted value
params._request: string API being requested to be mined
params._symbol: is the short string symbol for the api request

resultFor(bytes32).details: Allows the user to get the latest value for the requestId specified using the  ADO specification for the standard inteface for price oracles

params._bytesId: is the ADO standarized bytes32 price/key value pair identifier

resultFor(bytes32).return: the timestamp, outcome or value/ and the status code (for retreived, null, etc...)

setUserContract(address).details: allows owner to set the user contract address

devdoc.title: UsingTellor This contracts creates for easy integration to the Tellor Tellor System
